여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 일정을 짜다 = to plan/organize an itinerary. 일정이 빡빡하다 = the schedule is tight.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I took the city tour bus.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Loanword from English. 투어를 하다 = to do a tour. Also: 당일 투어 (day tour).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The guide explained in Korean.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 관광 가이드 = tour guide. 오디오 가이드 = audio guide.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The accommodation is close to the station.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: General term for any place to stay. 숙소를 잡다 = to book accommodation.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I'd like to book a single room.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 인(人) = person, 실(室) = room. Number + 인실 pattern: 2인실 (double), 4인실 (quad).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: How much is a double room per night?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 하루에 = per day/night. 1박 = one night stay. 1박 2일 = one night two days.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: This hotel includes breakfast.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 조식(朝食) is formal for breakfast. Casual: 아침(밥). 조식 뷔페 = breakfast buffet.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I swam at the hotel pool.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 수영(水泳) = swimming, 장(場) = place. 실내 수영장 = indoor pool, 야외 수영장 = outdoor pool.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I watched the sunrise at the beach.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Also called 바닷가 (seaside, casual). 해수욕장 = swimming beach (official term).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Korean people really like hiking.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 등산(登山) = climbing a mountain. Hiking is extremely popular in Korea at all ages.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Have you been to the National Museum of Korea?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 박물(博物) = broad knowledge, 관(館) = building. 미술관 = art museum.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: There are many historic sites in Gyeongju.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 유적(遺跡) = ruins/relics, 지(地) = place. Gyeongju is famous for Silla dynasty ruins.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Everland is the biggest amusement park in Korea.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 놀이 = play, 공원 = park. 롯데월드 and 에버랜드 are Korea's two major theme parks.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I relieved my fatigue at the hot spring.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 온(溫) = warm, 천(泉) = spring. 찜질방 (Korean spa/sauna) is a related cultural experience.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I'm going to the ski resort in winter.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 장(場) = place/venue. Popular Korean ski resorts include 용평, 하이원, 비발디파크.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The campground reservation filled up quickly.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 글램핑 (glamping) has become very popular in Korea in recent years.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: A rental car is convenient in Jeju Island.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Also written as 렌트카. 차를 빌리다 = to rent a car (native Korean expression).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: What transportation is available to the airport?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 교통(交通) = traffic/transport, 편(便) = way/service. 대중교통 = public transportation.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I bought a round-trip train ticket.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 왕(往) = go, 복(復) = return. Opposite: 편도 (one way).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: One one-way ticket, please.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Opposite of 왕복 (round trip). Used at ticket counters for trains, buses, and flights.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Can I assign a seat in advance?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Used for any assigned seat on planes, trains, buses, and theaters. 좌석 번호 = seat number.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: A window seat, please.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 창가 means 'by the window.' Used when booking flights or trains.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Are there any aisle seats left?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 통로 means 'aisle/corridor.' The opposite of 창가석.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Please put your bag in the luggage compartment.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 짐 (luggage) + 칸 (compartment/car). On planes, this is the overhead bin.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: You need to fill out the customs declaration form.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 세관 (customs) + 신고서 (declaration form). Given on international flights before landing.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The immigration line is really long.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 입국 (entering a country) + 심사 (screening/inspection). Happens after landing at the airport.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I'm going to transfer at Incheon Airport.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Used for both flight connections and subway/bus transfers. 환승 구역 = transit area.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: What gate number is it?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Loanword from English. Also called 탑승구 in formal Korean.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: We depart from Terminal 2.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Loanword. Used for airports and bus terminals. 버스 터미널 = bus terminal.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: What time is the departure?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 출발 (departure) + 시간 (time). Check 출발 시간 on your 탑승권 (boarding pass).

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The arrival time has been changed.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 도착 (arrival) + 시간 (time). 예정 도착 시간 = estimated arrival time.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The flight was delayed by two hours.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Often used as 지연되다 (to be delayed). Check airport screens for 지연 notices.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: The flight was cancelled because of a typhoon.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 취소하다 = to cancel, 취소되다 = to be cancelled. 취소 수수료 = cancellation fee.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Did you receive the reservation confirmation email?
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 예약 (reservation) + 확인 (confirmation). 예약 확인증 = confirmation receipt.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: Hotel prices go up a lot during peak season.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Opposite of 비수기. Summer vacation and holidays like 추석/설날 are 성수기.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: It's much cheaper if you go during the off-season.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 비 (not) + 수 (demand) + 기 (period). Best time for budget travel.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: This time I'm going on a package tour.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Everything (flights, hotel, tours) is included. Popular with Korean travelers to Europe and Southeast Asia.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I prefer independent travel.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: Opposite of 패키지 여행. You plan everything yourself. Also called 자유 투어.

여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example: 해외여행 가기 전에 여행 보험에 가입했어요.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).example_en: I signed up for travel insurance before going abroad.
여행 & 관광 (Travel & Tourism).notes: 여행 (travel) + 보험 (insurance). Covers medical emergencies and lost luggage abroad.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I cook at home on weekends.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 요리 (noun) = cooking/dish. 한국 요리 = Korean cuisine. 요리사 = chef.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Boiling ramen is easy.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 끓다 = to boil (intransitive). 끓이다 = to boil something (transitive/causative).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please stir-fry the vegetables first.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 볶음 = stir-fried dish. 볶음밥 = fried rice, 김치볶음 = stir-fried kimchi.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I grill the meat over charcoal.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Irregular verb: 굽다 → 구워요. 구이 = grilled dish. 삼겹살을 굽다 = to grill pork belly.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I steam dumplings and eat them.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 찜 = steamed dish. 갈비찜 = braised/steamed short ribs. 계란찜 = steamed egg.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I deep fry the chicken until it's crispy.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 튀김 = fried food/tempura. 바삭하다 = crispy. Korean fried chicken (치킨) is world-famous.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please chop the onion finely.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 잘게 = finely, 크게 = roughly/largely. 채 썰다 = to julienne/cut into strips.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: You mix bibimbap well before eating.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 비비다 also means to mix (as in 비빔밥). 섞다 is the general mixing word.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I add just a little salt.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Very common cooking verb. 넣다 means to put something into a container or pot.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I heat it up in the microwave and eat it.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 데우다 = to warm something up. 따뜻하게 데우다 = to warm up nicely.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: It's too hot, so I cool it down a bit.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 식다 = to cool down (intransitive). 식히다 = to cool something down (causative).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please taste and check if the seasoning is right.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 맛 = taste + 보다 = to try/see. A compound verb meaning to sample the flavor.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I season it with salt.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 간 = saltiness/seasoning level. 간이 세다 = too salty. 간이 싱겁다 = too bland.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I found the recipe on YouTube.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Loanword from English. 요리법 is the native Korean equivalent but 레시피 is more common casually.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please prepare the ingredients in advance.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 재료(材料) = materials/ingredients. Used for cooking and crafting contexts.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I make the seasoning and marinate the meat.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 양념하다 = to season. 양념치킨 = seasoned fried chicken. 재우다 = to marinate.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I boil water in a big pot.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 냄비 is a standard cooking pot. 뚝배기 = earthenware pot (for stews like 된장찌개).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Coat the frying pan with oil.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 기름을 두르다 = to coat with oil. Also called 후라이팬 in casual speech.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I chop vegetables on the cutting board.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 나무 도마 = wooden cutting board. 플라스틱 도마 = plastic cutting board.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I use the knife carefully.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 식칼 = kitchen knife. 과도 = fruit knife. 칼이 잘 들다 = the knife is sharp.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I scoop the soup with a ladle.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 뜨다 = to scoop/ladle out. 국 = soup. Essential tool for Korean soups and stews.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I flip the pancake with a spatula.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 뒤집다 = to flip over. 전 = Korean savory pancake (김치전, 파전, etc.).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I put rice in a bowl.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: General term for bowls and dishes. 담다 = to put food into a container/plate.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please take out a clean plate.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 접시 is flat, 그릇 is deeper. 앞접시 = small plate for individual servings.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please pour water into the cup.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 따르다 = to pour. 종이컵 = paper cup. 머그컵 = mug.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I poured juice into a glass.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 유리 = glass (material), 잔 = cup/glass. 소주잔 = soju glass. 맥주잔 = beer glass.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please give me some napkins.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Also called 냅킨 or 휴지 (tissue/paper). In Korean restaurants, 휴지 is more commonly used.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I wear an apron when cooking.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 앞 = front, 치마 = skirt. Literally a 'front skirt' that protects your clothes.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I put the cake in the oven.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Not as common in Korean kitchens as in Western ones. 전자레인지 (microwave) is more standard.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please turn on the gas stove.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 불을 켜다 = to turn on the burner. 불을 끄다 = to turn off the burner.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: These days, many people use induction cooktops.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Increasingly popular in Korean apartments. Requires special cookware (인덕션 전용).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I cook rice in the rice cooker.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 전기(電氣) = electric, 밥솥 = rice pot. 밥을 하다 = to cook rice. Essential Korean appliance.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I make fruit juice with a blender.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Also called 블렌더. 핸드 블렌더 = immersion/hand blender.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I put the leftover food in the freezer.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 냉동(冷凍) = freezing, 실(室) = room/compartment. 냉장실 = refrigerator compartment.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: You need to control the heat well.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 불 = fire, but in cooking it refers to the heat level. 불을 줄이다 = to reduce heat.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I simmer it slowly on low heat.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 약(弱) = weak. 약불에 졸이다 = to reduce/simmer on low heat.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I stir-fry quickly on high heat.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 강(強) = strong. High heat is used for quick stir-frying and bringing water to a boil.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I cook it on medium heat for about 10 minutes.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 중(中) = middle. Most everyday Korean cooking is done on medium heat.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: This food tastes really good.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 맛있다 = delicious. 맛없다 = not tasty. Korean has five basic tastes: 단맛 (sweet), 짠맛 (salty), 신맛 (sour), 쓴맛 (bitter), 매운맛 (spicy).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: The aroma of sesame oil is really nice.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 향(香) = fragrance. 참기름 = sesame oil, a signature Korean cooking ingredient. 향이 나다 = to smell of.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I dress the spinach with sesame oil.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Classic Korean technique for 나물 (seasoned vegetables). 콩나물 무침, 시금치 무침, etc.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).english: to pickle; to salt; to marinate
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I salt the napa cabbage.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Key step in making 김치. Also used for making 장아찌 (pickled vegetables).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Please mince the garlic finely.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 다진 마늘 (minced garlic) and 다진 고기 (ground meat) are common in Korean cooking.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I grind peppers to make chili flakes.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Used for grinding spices, beans, or grains. 빻은 후추 = ground pepper.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: If you strain the broth through a sieve, it's cleaner.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 체 (sieve) + 에 거르다 is a common combination. Also used for filtering coffee.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: This year I made kimchi myself.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 김치를 담그다 is the standard way to say 'to make kimchi.' Also means to soak/submerge.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I reduce the soy sauce seasoning on low heat.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Used when reducing liquid to thicken a sauce. 조림 (braised dish) comes from this verb.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I boil the eggs for 10 minutes.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Different from 끓이다 (to bring liquid to a boil). 삶다 focuses on boiling an item in water.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I defrost the meat in the fridge.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 해동 (thawing). Can also use 녹이다 (to melt/thaw) in casual speech. 자연 해동 = natural thawing.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I store the leftover food in the fridge.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 냉장 보관 = refrigerated storage, 냉동 보관 = frozen storage, 실온 보관 = room temperature storage.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: You should throw away milk that's past the expiration date.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 유통 (distribution) + 기한 (time limit). Recently Korea also uses 소비기한 (use-by date).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: It's convenient if you prepare the ingredients in advance.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 식 (food) + 재료 (ingredients). More formal than just 재료.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).english: basic side dishes; make-ahead side dishes
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: I make several basic side dishes on the weekend.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 밑 (base/bottom) + 반찬 (side dishes). Pre-made sides kept in the fridge for the week.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: This broth is really refreshing.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 시원하다 for soup means 'refreshing/satisfying,' not 'cold.' 국물 요리 = soup-based dishes.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example: 양이 너무 많아서 다 못 먹었어요.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: The portion was too big so I couldn't finish it all.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 양이 많다/적다 = the portion is big/small. Very commonly used at restaurants.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: How much is one serving?
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 인분 is the counter for servings. 2인분, 3인분, etc. Many Korean restaurants have a minimum of 2인분.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: The food is here, enjoy your meal!
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Said by servers or the person who cooked. 드시다 is the honorific form of 먹다.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).english: to be well-seasoned; the seasoning is right
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: The seasoning is just right, it's really delicious.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 간 here means 'seasoning/saltiness.' 간이 세다 = too salty, 간이 싱겁다 = too bland.

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example: 불 조절을 잘 해야 안 타요.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: You need to control the heat well so it doesn't burn.
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: 불 (fire/heat) + 조절 (control). 약불 (low), 중불 (medium), 강불 (high).

요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).example_en: Add sesame oil at the end and it's done!
요리 & 부엌 (Cooking & Kitchen).notes: Often used at the end of recipe videos/blogs. 완성하다 = to complete, 완성되다 = to be completed.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I lost my wallet. What should I do!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Contraction of 어떻게 해요. Expresses panic or distress. Very common in daily speech.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: They say it'll rain tomorrow. — Really?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: A gentle way to show surprise or acknowledge information. Softer than 진짜요?

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Studying Korean is fun, right? — That's right.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Short for 그렇지요. Used to agree with someone. Very natural in conversation.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Is this Gangnam Station? — Yes, that's correct.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 맞다 (to be correct). Used to confirm facts or agree with statements.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: They say there's no test tomorrow. — Oh really?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 진짜 = real/really. Adding 아 at the beginning shows genuine surprise.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I passed the exam! — Awesome!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Originally meant 'jackpot.' Now a very popular exclamation for anything surprising or impressive.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Oh my, that must have been hard.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: A quintessential Korean exclamation expressing sympathy, exhaustion, surprise, or frustration.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Whoa, that person got married?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Casual/slang exclamation popular with younger speakers. Expresses shock or disbelief.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Do well on the exam, fighting!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Borrowed from English but used as encouragement. Also spelled 화이팅. Used everywhere in Korea.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Yes! Tomorrow is a holiday!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: An exclamation of joy or excitement. Similar to pumping your fist and saying 'yes!'

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Come on, that's not right.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Expresses mild disappointment, disbelief, or playful protest.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Is this delicious? — Hmm, I'm not sure.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Used when hesitating or unsure. Shows you're thinking before answering.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Why did you come? — Just because.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Extremely common filler word. Can mean 'just because,' 'without reason,' or 'as is.'

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: How's that movie? — Not great.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 별로 is usually used with negative expressions. A polite way to say something is not good.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: it doesn't matter / I don't mind
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: What do you want to eat? — Anything, I don't mind.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 상관(相關) = relation/concern. 상관하다 = to care about. Very useful for being flexible.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: it's done / forget it / that's enough
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Shall I give you more? — That's enough, thank you.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 되다 (to become). Can mean 'it's finished,' 'no thanks,' or 'forget it' depending on tone.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: oh I see / ah, so that's how it is
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: So that's why I was late. — Oh, I see.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Shows understanding or realization. 구나 is an exclamatory ending expressing new awareness.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I like coffee. — Me too!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 저 = I (humble), 도 = also. 나도 is the casual equivalent.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: it can't be helped / there's nothing we can do
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: 비가 와서 취소됐어요. — 어쩔 수 없어요.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: It was canceled because of rain. — It can't be helped.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 어찌할 수 없다 is the full form. Expresses resigned acceptance of a situation.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: 이 가격이 백만 원이에요. — 말도 안 돼요!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: This costs one million won. — No way!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Literally 'it doesn't even make words.' Expresses disbelief at something unreasonable.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: You worked hard today too.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 고생(苦生) = hardship. Said to acknowledge someone's effort. Very common after work or projects.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: You passed the exam? Well done!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 잘 = well + 했어요 = did. Used to praise or congratulate someone.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I got angry for no reason.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Implies the action was unnecessary or regrettable. 괜히 걱정했어요 = I worried needlessly.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: There's nothing in the fridge.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 아무 = any + 것 = thing + 도 = even/also. Used with negative verbs.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: There's nobody at home.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 아무 = any + 도 = even. Must be used with a negative verb (없다, 안, 못).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Please sit anywhere.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 아무데 = any place + 나 = or (any). With 나 it's positive: 'anywhere is fine.'

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: 먹고 싶은 거 있어요? — 아무거나 괜찮아요.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Is there anything you want to eat? — Anything is fine.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 아무것 = anything + 이나 → 아무거나. Used when you have no preference.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: 얼굴이 안 좋아 보여요. 무슨 일이에요?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: You don't look well. What's wrong?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 무슨 = what kind of, 일 = matter/event. A caring way to ask about someone's problem.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: what's the matter? / why are you like that?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Why are you suddenly like that?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 왜 = why, 그래요 = are you like that. Can show concern or confusion.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm looking forward to the trip next week.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 기대(期待) = expectation. 기대되다 = to be anticipated. 기대하다 = to look forward to.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm troubled about what to choose.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 고민(苦悶) = worry/anguish. 고민하다 = to agonize over. 고민 상담 = counseling.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: You went to Europe? I'm envious!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 부럽다 = to be envious (ㅂ irregular: 부러워요). Used lightheartedly, not with negative connotation.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: what do I do? / how do I do it?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: How do I do this?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 어떻게 = how. Can ask for instructions or express helplessness depending on context.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Sorry, but please speak slowly.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 천천히 = slowly. Essential phrase for language learners. 주세요 makes it a polite request.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I didn't hear. Please say it again.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 다시 = again. Another essential phrase for language learners asking for repetition.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm sorry, I can't speak Korean well.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 잘 못하다 = can't do well. Useful disclaimer when starting a Korean conversation.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: What does this word mean?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 뜻 = meaning. Essential for vocabulary learning. 뜻을 모르다 = to not know the meaning.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: What's this in Korean? — It's 'sagwa' (apple).
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: (으)로 = in (language/means). 영어로 = in English. Extremely helpful phrase for learners.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Excuse me, where is the bathroom?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 화장실(化粧室) = restroom (lit. makeup room). One of the most essential survival phrases.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: How long does it take from here to Myeongdong?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 걸리다 = to take (time). 시간이 걸리다 = it takes time. Very practical phrase.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: What time is it now? — It's three o'clock.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 몇 = how many. Korean uses two number systems: 한 시, 두 시 (native) for hours; 일 분, 이 분 (Sino) for minutes.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Is the subway station close from here?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 가깝다 = to be close (ㅂ irregular: 가까워요). Opposite: 멀어요 (far).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: it's okay / I'm fine / no worries
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm sorry. — It's okay.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: One of the most versatile Korean expressions. Can mean 'it's fine,' 'no thanks,' 'are you okay?' as a question.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Just a moment, I'll be right there.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 잠깐 = a moment, 만 = just/only. 잠시만요 is a slightly more formal variant.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Thank you. — You're welcome.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Literally means 'not at all' (not even one in ten million). Somewhat formal; 아니에요 is more casual.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Can you help me? — Of course!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Short for 그러면요. Enthusiastic agreement. 당연하죠 is a stronger version.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Can you come tomorrow? — Probably.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 아마 = maybe, 도 = also (softener). Less committal than 네 but more likely than 글쎄요.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: 길이 막힐 수도 있어요. — 그럴 수도 있어요.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: There might be traffic. — That could be.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 그렇다 + -(으)ㄹ 수도 있다. A diplomatic way to partially agree or acknowledge a possibility.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: I don't know / I'm not sure
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I don't know the answer to this question.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 모르다 = to not know + 겠 (uncertainty). Softer than 몰라요 (I don't know, more blunt).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Do you want to go together? — I'll think about it.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 생각하다 = to think + 아/어 보다 = to try + ㄹ게요 = I will. A polite way to defer a decision.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: A: 요즘 날씨가 너무 덥죠? B: 그러니까요.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: A: The weather is so hot lately, right? B: I know, right.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Used to strongly agree with what someone just said. Very natural in conversation.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: A: 내일 올 거죠? B: 당연하죠!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: A: You're coming tomorrow, right? B: Of course!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: A confident, friendly way to say 'obviously.' 당연히 is the adverb form.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: A: 매운 거 좋아해요. B: 저도 그래요!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: A: I like spicy food. B: Same here!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: More specific than 저도요. Literally 'I'm also like that.' Used to express shared feelings or habits.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: A: 점심에 냉면 먹을까요? B: 좋은 생각이에요!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: A: Shall we have cold noodles for lunch? B: That's a good idea!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: A polite way to agree with someone's suggestion. Can also say 좋은 생각이네요 for a more surprised tone.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example: A: 이 단어 뜻 알아요? B: 잘 모르겠는데요.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: A: Do you know the meaning of this word? B: I'm not really sure.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Softer and more polite than 몰라요. The -는데요 ending leaves room for further discussion.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: It looks difficult but I'll give it a try.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 한번 adds a sense of 'just once' or 'for a try.' Very commonly used to show willingness.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I don't have time today, let's meet next time.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: A common and direct way to decline invitations. Can soften with 시간이 좀 없어서요...

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm a bit busy this week.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 바쁘다. Adding 좀 makes it softer. Very frequently used to explain unavailability.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm tired because I had a lot of work today.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 피곤하다. One of the most common daily expressions. 너무 피곤해요 = I'm so tired.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I haven't eaten lunch yet so I'm hungry.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 배고프다. 배 = stomach. Very casual and commonly used.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'm thirsty after exercising.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 목마르다. 목 = throat. Can also say 목이 말라요 with the same meaning.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I just arrived, where are you?
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Very commonly texted when meeting someone. Short form: 도착! or 나 도착 (casual).

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Sorry I'm late, traffic was bad.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Polite apology for lateness. Casual: 늦어서 미안해요. Very casual: 늦어서 미안!

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: I'll go first; I'll head out
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'll head out first, good work everyone!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Said when leaving before others, especially at work or gatherings. Very polite and common.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I had fun today, see you tomorrow!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: A common farewell. Can swap 내일 for other times: 다음 주에 봐요, 나중에 봐요, etc.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: I'll contact you; I'll be in touch
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I'll check the schedule and contact you.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: 연락 = contact/communication. One of the most frequently used parting phrases.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Well then, take care, I'll be in touch again.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: A warm farewell, especially when you won't see someone for a while. 잘 지내다 = to be doing well.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: It's raining outside, get home safe!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: Very common farewell in Korean. Shows care for the other person. Casual: 조심히 가!

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: Today was fun, let's meet again next time!
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: A warm and friendly farewell. 또 emphasizes 'again.' Very natural ending to a meetup.

자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).english: I had fun; it was enjoyable
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).example_en: I had fun traveling together.
자주 쓰는 표현 (Common Expressions).notes: From 즐겁다 (to be enjoyable). Used to express that you enjoyed shared time. Past tense is standard here.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I don't have enough money, so I need to earn more.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: The most basic and common word for money in Korean.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Can I pay with cash?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 현(present/actual) + 금(gold/money). Used when distinguishing from card payment.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I'll pay by card.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Loanword from English. In Korea, card payment is extremely common.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I checked my credit card limit.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 신용(credit/trust) + 카드(card). Has a monthly billing cycle.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: A debit card deducts directly from your account balance.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: More popular than credit cards among younger Koreans for budget control.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I want to open a new account.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 계좌번호 means account number. 개설하다 means to open an account.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Let me check how much is left in my bankbook.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Physical bankbooks are still used in Korea, though less common now.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I'm saving 30% of my salary every month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 저축하다 is the verb form. A general term for saving money.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The fixed deposit interest rate went up.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 예금 is money deposited in a bank. 정기예금 means fixed-term deposit.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I'm going to make a withdrawal at the ATM.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 출(out) + 금(money). Opposite of 입금(deposit).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I transferred money through mobile banking.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 이체하다 is the verb form. 계좌이체 means bank transfer.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The fee is expensive when sending money overseas.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 송(send) + 금(money). Often used for international transfers.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I took out a loan to buy a house.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 대출받다 means to take out a loan. 대출금 means loan amount.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The interest is so high that it's burdensome.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Can refer to both interest earned on savings and interest paid on loans.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: How much is the inter-bank transfer fee?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Applies to banking fees, service charges, and commissions.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The payment didn't go through because of insufficient balance.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 잔(remaining) + 액(amount). 잔액조회 means balance inquiry.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: My salary was deposited into my account.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 입(in) + 금(money). Opposite of 출금(withdrawal).

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Where is the nearest ATM?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Pronounced 에이티엠 in Korean. Also called 현금인출기.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 비밀번호를 세 번 틀리면 카드가 잠겨요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: If you enter the wrong PIN three times, your card gets locked.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 비밀(secret) + 번호(number). Used for all passwords and PINs.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The exchange rate is bad if you exchange at the airport.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 환전하다 is the verb form. 환전소 is a currency exchange booth.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: What is today's exchange rate?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 환(exchange) + 율(rate). Fluctuates daily.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I want to exchange dollars to won.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Loanword from English. 미국 달러 specifies US dollars.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 일본 여행 가기 전에 엔화를 준비했어요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I prepared yen before my trip to Japan.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Japanese currency. 엔화 is the more formal term.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The euro has gone up a lot.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: European currency. 유로화 is the more formal term.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: You have to pay in yuan in China.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Chinese currency. 위안화 is the more formal term.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Do you need a receipt?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Very common question at Korean stores. 영수증 발급 means receipt issuance.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Is this the price including tax?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 세(tax) + 금(money). 세금 신고 means tax filing.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: VAT is included in this price.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Short for 부가가치세. Korea's VAT is 10%.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I'll pay in 3 monthly installments.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Very common in Korea. 무이자 할부 means interest-free installments.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Please process it as a one-time payment.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Opposite of 할부. Paying the full amount at once.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The monthly rent is 500,000 won per month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 월(month) + 세(tax/rent). The most common rental system for young Koreans.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I signed a 2-year key money deposit contract.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Unique Korean rental system where a large deposit replaces monthly rent.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: What should I do to get my deposit back?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Required for both 월세 and 전세 rentals in Korea.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: How much is the maintenance fee for this apartment?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Monthly fee for apartment building maintenance, often separate from rent.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The utility bills were high this month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Umbrella term covering electricity, water, gas, etc.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 여름에 에어컨을 많이 쓰면 전기세가 올라가요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: If you use the AC a lot in summer, the electricity bill goes up.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 전기(electricity) + 세(tax/fee). Korea uses progressive electricity pricing.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The water bill usually isn't much.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 수도(waterworks) + 세(tax/fee). Generally cheaper than electricity.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 겨울에 난방 때문에 가스비가 많이 나와요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The gas bill is high in winter because of heating.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 가스(gas) + 비(cost). Many Korean homes use gas for heating and cooking.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I pay the internet bill by automatic transfer every month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 인터넷(internet) + 비(cost). Korea has some of the fastest internet in the world.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The health insurance premium went up.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 보험(insurance) + 료(fee). National health insurance is mandatory in Korea.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I'm putting 300,000 won into my savings plan every month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: A savings product where you deposit a fixed amount monthly for a set period.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Have you ever invested in a fund?
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Loanword from English. 펀드 매니저 means fund manager.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: The stock market is unstable these days.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 주식 투자 means stock investment. Very popular among young Koreans.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Many people invest in real estate.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 투자(investment) + 하다(to do). Can be used for money, time, or effort.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 열심히 일해서 돈을 많이 벌고 싶어요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I want to work hard and earn a lot of money.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 돈을 벌다 is the most common collocation. Irregular verb.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 이번 달에 돈을 너무 많이 썼어요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I spent too much money this month.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 쓰다 has multiple meanings: to spend, to write, to use, to wear (hat). Past tense: 썼다.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I pack a lunchbox to save money.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Can also mean to cherish or treasure something or someone.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example: 필요 없는 물건을 사는 건 낭비예요.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Buying things you don't need is a waste.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: 낭비(waste) + 하다(to do). Can apply to money, time, or resources.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: Here is your change.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: From 거스르다(to give back) + 돈(money). Less common now due to card payments.

은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).example_en: I have so many coins that it's heavy.
은행 & 돈 (Banking & Money).notes: Korean coins come in 10원, 50원, 100원, and 500원 denominations.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Did you watch the soccer game today?
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Used for competitive sports matches. 경기장 means stadium.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: That athlete is really amazing.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Used for professional and amateur athletes alike. 축구 선수 = soccer player.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Which team do you cheer for?
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Used in sports and work contexts.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example: 새 감독이 오고 나서 팀이 강해졌어요.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: The team got stronger after the new coach came.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Used for sports coaches and film directors alike.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: The referee gave a red card.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 심판하다 means to judge or referee. Used across all sports.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: As many as 50,000 spectators came.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 관(watch) + 중(crowd). Specifically for live event audiences.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: My throat hurts from cheering so hard.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 응원하다 is the verb form. Korean cheering culture is very enthusiastic.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: They advanced to the finals with this victory.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 승리하다 means to win/be victorious. More formal than 이기다(to win).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: They lost unfortunately, but they fought well.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 패배하다 means to be defeated. More formal than 지다(to lose).

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: The game ended in a 1-1 draw.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 무(no) + 승부(win-or-lose). Neither team wins.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: What's the score right now?
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Used in sports and academics. 점수를 따다 means to score points.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: They scored a goal at the end and made a comeback.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 골을 넣다 means to score a goal. 골키퍼 means goalkeeper.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: They finally won the championship!
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 우승하다 means to win the championship. 우승팀 means champion team.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Being runner-up is also a great result.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 준(semi/quasi) + 우승(championship). Second place.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: We won many medals at this Olympics.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 메달을 따다 means to win a medal. Loanword from English.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I'm so happy to have won a gold medal.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 금(gold) + 메달(medal). The highest honor in competition.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: A silver medal is also a really proud result.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 은(silver) + 메달(medal). Second place award.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: They barely secured the bronze medal.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 동(bronze/copper) + 메달(medal). Third place award.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: The 2024 Olympics were held in Paris.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Korea hosted the 1988 Seoul Olympics and 2018 PyeongChang Winter Olympics.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example: 월드컵 때 한국 거리가 빨간색으로 물들어요.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: During the World Cup, Korean streets are colored red.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Korea co-hosted the 2002 FIFA World Cup. Red Devils are the famous fan group.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Gymnasts have really great flexibility.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 체(body) + 조(make/exercise). Includes floor, vault, bars, etc.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: In weightlifting, technique is important, not just strength.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 역(power) + 도(way). An Olympic sport Korea has traditionally been strong in.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Korea is a powerhouse in archery.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 양(Western) + 궁(bow). Korea dominates Olympic archery.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Fencing requires fast reaction speed.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Korea has won many Olympic fencing medals.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Learning judo helps with self-defense.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 유(gentle) + 도(way). Originally from Japan, very popular in Korea.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Wrestling matches are divided by weight class.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Korea has Olympic wrestling tradition.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Boxing is also popular as a diet exercise.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. 복싱 체육관 means boxing gym.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Let's go skating in winter.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Includes ice skating and roller skating. 김연아 is Korea's most famous skater.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I want to learn how to snowboard.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Popular at Korean ski resorts.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Many people enjoy surfing in Yangyang.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Yangyang on Korea's east coast is the most popular surfing spot.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I go to an indoor climbing gym.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Also called 볼더링(bouldering). Very trendy exercise in Korea.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I jog along the Han River every morning.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 한강 parks are popular jogging spots in Seoul.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example: 운동 전에 스트레칭을 꼭 해야 해요.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: You must stretch before exercising.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Important for injury prevention. 스트레칭하다 is the verb form.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I did 50 sit-ups.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Literally 'upper body raising.' Part of Korean fitness tests in schools.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I do 30 push-ups every day.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Literally 'arm bend-and-extend.' Also part of Korean military fitness tests.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Squats are good for lower body exercise.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. One of the most popular strength exercises.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: It's hard to hold a plank for more than 1 minute.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Great for core strength.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: You build muscle when you exercise.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 근육통 means muscle pain/soreness. 근육질 means muscular build.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I get tired easily because my stamina is low.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 체(body) + 력(power). 체력 관리 means maintaining physical fitness.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Endurance is important for marathons.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 지구(sustain) + 력(power). The ability to keep going for a long time.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: Doing yoga improves your flexibility.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 유연(flexible) + 성(quality). Important for preventing injuries.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: This food is high in calories.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. 칼로리 소모 means calorie burn.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example: 운동 후에 단백질을 섭취하는 게 좋아요.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: It's good to consume protein after exercising.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 닭가슴살(chicken breast) is the go-to protein source for Korean fitness fans.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I reduce carbohydrates when dieting.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Often shortened to 탄수 in casual speech. Rice is Korea's main carb source.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: You need to consume nutrients in a balanced way.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 영양(nutrition) + 소(element). Includes vitamins, minerals, etc.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I'm putting together a healthy meal plan.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 식단 관리 means diet management. 식단표 means meal plan chart.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I go to the gym after work.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: 헬스(health) + 장(place). Also called 피트니스 센터 or just 헬스.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I'm learning exercises from a personal trainer.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Often shortened to PT (피티). 퍼스널 트레이너 is the full form.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: I tried changing my workout routine.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Used for workout routines and daily routines.

스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example: 워밍업 없이 운동하면 다칠 수 있어요.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).example_en: You can get injured if you exercise without warming up.
스포츠 & 운동 (Sports & Exercise).notes: Loanword from English. Essential before any intense exercise.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I always watch the news in the morning.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Major Korean news channels include KBS, MBC, SBS.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Have you read this article?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 뉴스 기사 means news article. Also means driver (택시 기사) in a different context.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example: 요즘은 종이 신문을 읽는 사람이 적어요.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: These days, few people read paper newspapers.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 신(new) + 문(writing). 신문사 means newspaper company.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I subscribe to a fashion magazine.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 잡(miscellaneous) + 지(paper). Covers various specialty topics.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: What time does that broadcast start?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 방송하다 means to broadcast. 방송국 means broadcasting station.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Let's flip through the channels.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Also used for YouTube channels.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: What interesting programs are on these days?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Often shortened to 프로. Covers TV shows, radio programs, etc.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Korean variety shows are really fun.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Short for 예능 프로그램. A signature genre of Korean TV.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I like nature documentaries.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Often shortened to 다큐 in casual speech.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: That news anchor has precise pronunciation.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Also called 아나운서(announcer). A respected profession in Korea.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The reporter is broadcasting live from the scene.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 기(record) + 자(person). 취재하다 means to cover a story.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Isn't this ad really funny?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 광고하다 means to advertise. Korean ads are known for using celebrities.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I listen to the radio during my commute.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Korean radio shows often feature celebrity DJs.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example: 한국어 공부할 때 팟캐스트가 도움이 돼요.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Podcasts help when studying Korean.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Increasingly popular in Korea.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Do you want to go see a movie this weekend?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 영화를 보다 means to watch a movie. Korean cinema is world-renowned.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The newly opened movie theater has great facilities.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: CGV, 메가박스, 롯데시네마 are Korea's major theater chains.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I like director Bong Joon-ho's movies.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Same word as sports coach. Context determines the meaning.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: That actor's acting is really natural.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Gender-neutral term. 남자 배우(actor), 여자 배우(actress) for specificity.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Who is the main character of this drama?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 주(main) + 인(person) + 공(public). Used for movies, dramas, and novels.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: This movie was filmed on Jeju Island.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 촬영하다 means to film/shoot. 촬영지 means filming location.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: A new movie is releasing next week.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 개봉하다 means to release (a movie). 개봉일 means release date.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I left a review after watching the movie.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 관람하다 is more formal than 보다. 관람객 means viewer/visitor.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example: 자막 없이 한국 영화를 보고 싶어요.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I want to watch Korean movies without subtitles.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 자(letter) + 막(screen). 한글 자막 means Korean subtitles.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Is there a Korean dubbed version?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. 더빙하다 means to dub.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example: 인기 있는 영화는 미리 예매해야 해요.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: You have to book tickets in advance for popular movies.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 예매하다 means to pre-book. Used for movies, concerts, trains, etc.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: What kind of music do you like?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 음(sound) + 악(music). K-pop has made Korean music globally popular.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Do you have a favorite singer?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 가(sing) + 수(person). Used for solo artists and group members.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example: 요즘 한국 인디 밴드가 인기 있어요.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Korean indie bands are popular these days.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. 밴드 음악 means band music.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: That singer also composes their own music.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 작(make) + 곡(song). 작곡가 means composer.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Who wrote the lyrics for this song?
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 작(make) + 사(words). 작사가 means lyricist.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: A new album came out.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. K-pop albums often include photocards and photobooks.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: They released a single before the album.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. A single song release, often as a teaser for an album.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The music video views exceeded 100 million.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Often abbreviated as MV(엠브이). K-pop MVs are known for high production value.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The concert tickets sold out in 5 minutes.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. K-pop concerts are known for organized fan culture.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I saw the singer up close at the fan meeting.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: An event where fans meet their favorite artists. Very popular in K-pop culture.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I went to see a musical performance.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 공연하다 means to perform. Covers concerts, plays, musicals, etc.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: My dream is to sing on stage.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 무대에 서다 means to stand on stage. 무대 뒤 means backstage.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The stage lighting was really cool.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 조(shine) + 명(bright). Important element of concerts and performances.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I can't hear the microphone well.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Also shortened to 마이크 or 마이크로폰.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I play music through a Bluetooth speaker.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. Refers to the audio device, not a person speaking.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: You dance really well!
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 춤을 추다 means to dance. K-pop is famous for synchronized group dances.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: The choreography for the new song looks difficult.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 안(peace) + 무(dance). 안무가 means choreographer.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I was moved by that actor's acting.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 연기하다 means to act. 연기력 means acting ability.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I'm happy that I passed the audition.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. K-pop trainees go through rigorous audition processes.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: That group debuted last year.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 데뷔하다 means to debut. A major milestone in K-pop and acting careers.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: This song is the biggest hit of the year.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 히트(hit) + 곡(song). A song that achieves widespread popularity.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: This song reached number 1 on the music chart.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Melon, Genie, and Bugs are major Korean music chart platforms.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I stream dramas on Netflix.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. 스트리밍 서비스 means streaming service.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: Please subscribe to my YouTube channel.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: 구독하다 means to subscribe. 구독자 means subscriber.

미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).example_en: I posted a movie review on my blog.
미디어 & 엔터테인먼트 (Media & Entertainment).notes: Loanword from English. 리뷰를 쓰다 means to write a review.
